page.title: 02Standing Stones
page.content: STONE MONUMENTS It seems most likely that the stone monuments on Exmoor were erected in the Bronze Age.People think that these stones were used for worship or landmarks. STONE CIRCLES The present evidence shows that the stone circles are usually attributed to the beaker cultures. The stone circles are no more than a couple of feet high. STANDING STONES On Exmoor and in some other stoney areas you may see standing stones.These are modern rubbing stones for cattle,while others are used more recently for boundary stones.Some of these single stones, however were set in place by men of the Bronze Age.
